utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brings you in?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, I've had this cough. It's been going on now for like last six months or so and been losing some weight as well. I've lost, I think like 20 or 30 pounds in the last six months.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, yeah, that's a lot of weight. So the weight loss, you said 20 to 30 pounds?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Like just over 200 and I'm in the 170s now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so that was in the past six months. When do the cough start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Well, I've had a cough before, uh, like a smokers cough. Ah, and that's been like a few couple of years, but that's just a cough that I would have in the morning and it would just go away but I mean around six months ago I started having this cough all day.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Hm, OK. And is it a dry cough or is it a productive cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, it's been it's been dry.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: It's been dry?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: So no blood or sputum?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, no blood or sputum.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you been feeling short of breath at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, I have, yeah the shortness of breath has been like similarly getting a bit worse over the last, over the last six months.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Alright, and is there wheeziness as well?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No wheezing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How about chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, yeah, I've had this kind of like dull kind of aching pain that, that I've had kind of work just on the right side of my chest. It, yeah. It's kind of aching and not that bad, but uncomfortable.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and and is it a sharp pain or is it a dull, achy pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's more like dull.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and is it always there or is it worse with like exertion?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's always there.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uhm, and sorry, you said it was at the centre of your chest?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: More kind of on the right side.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, does it get worse with like deep breaths?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not really, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. How about when you lean forward?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. Uhm, and hm. Have you ever been worked up for the chest pain in the past, like to rule out heart attacks, blocked arteries, anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, yeah actually, I had a stress test about a year ago and it the results of that were, were normal.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK good. And do you ever feel like your heart's racing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't had any anything like that. I mean like, sometimes I can get palpitations 'cause I have a fib or atrial fibrillation, but it doesn't really yeah, affect me that, that much.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And how about shortness, sorry, how about dizziness or fainting spells?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No. Any calf pain when you walk a lot?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. Any fevers?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No. How about fatigue?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not really, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, any rashes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Changes in your vision or hearing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Smell or taste?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: That's been normal.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Runny nose or stuffy nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Uhm, changes in your bowel movement?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No diarrhea.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And how about like blood in your stool or constipation?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No constipation and no blood in the stool.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Uhm, appetite changes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No way my appetite's been been OK, that's why I was like really shocked at the the weight loss.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Mhmm. Umm OK, how about changes in your urine?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I mean sometimes I can have a, I mean harder time to go 'cause as an old guy have large prostate I think they said, but I mean that's been OK.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. How about headaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No headaches.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Numbness or tingling?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No numbness or tingling.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Confusion or memory loss?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Joint pains or muscle aches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I mean sometimes I can get so like my knees will hurt, but I think that's just arthritis.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, yeah. Umm, alright and are you otherwise healthy? You mentioned that you have a-fib and prostate issues. Anything else?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, yeah like high blood pressure and uh, yeah, uh just high blood pressure.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: High blood pressure, OK. Have you ever been diagnosed with something called COPD?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I I I was tested for that with the like the breathing test, I did blow into tube but yeah, they said that I didn't have it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK. When were you worked up for that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I was probably like I don't know 5 to 10 years ago now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Alright, and are you on any medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I take one for high blood pressure and I think a beta blocker as well for that like the heart rate and uh, a-fib.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, yeah. OK. and, and are you up to date with your immunizations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I am yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no allergies.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Family history of lung or heart conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, I think like my uncle had lung cancer and it, and I think I've had a couple of member family members about who had lung cancer actually, but they've well, they've all been smokers.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh I see. OK. Do you know what type of lung cancer they got?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I'm I'm not sure.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. No problem. And OK, so I think you mentioned that you smoke. How much do you smoke and for how long have you been smoking?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I smoke about a pack per day and I guess probably even smoking now for, I mean, I, I guess like 60 years almost, maybe longer.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: And before that I there was a point I was smoking 2 packs a day.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh wow, OK, well it's good that you cut down.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Mhmm.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, alright, and do you do any other recreational drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. And how about alcohol? Do you drink?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Probably one or two beers every day.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Every day, OK. And what's your living situation like right now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so I live with my wife in a in a townhouse.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK. Alright, that's good. Any reasons to think you have like old carpets, dust, asbestos, mold. Anything like that in the house?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Uh, OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, any pets?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No pets.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No pets, OK. Have you been in contact with anyone sick recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. How about travel?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I've been, uh, yeah we've been at been at home.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: At home, OK. OK, well those are all the questions I had for you. Did you have any questions of your own for myself?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, no, I was just like, well, really worried that I I could have lung cancer.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, for sure. So that is quite high on my differential right now just because of your age, your smoking history and just the way you're presenting. So we're gonna do a couple of things. We're going to do a Covid swab just to rule that out. You should hear back in about 24 to 48 hours, but we will do investigations for lung cancer, so we'll start by doing a chest x-ray just to look for a mass or effusions and then from there if we think there are signs of cancer, we can do a CT. Umm, as well we can like stage with the Pet CT after we take a biopsy and send it off for pathology and that should give us more answers as to if you have cancer and if you do have cancer, what type of cancer so that we can talk about treatment plans and kind of what the prognosis is with those particular types of cancers? How does that sound?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, that sounds great. Thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
